review: The service was amazing and the food was good, however we ordered salsa and fries and the salsa was terrible. Other than that it was good
I went there yesterday (9/29) and ordered the trio grilled fajitas...what I got was fajitas stew..almost a fajitas soup...with terribly soggy tortillas ...total muck for $17.-

The last time I was here, I had some kind of chicken pasta and I was underwhelmed with the flavor. This time I decided to get the rubbed ribs and I was not disappointed. My fries were well seasoned and my ribs were fall off the bone good. Even the sauce was good. I would definitely reccommend them.  The overall look and feel of the restaurant is casual and on my visits, it has always been clean, which I appreciate.  They added a little tablet-like device which allows you to reorder drinks and pay your bill all at the table which is great. Not paying together? You can split the bill.  I used to think of Chili's as a restaurant that I should just pass on by but I may be changing my mind. I may not go out of my way to dine there but I can see myself stopping by every now and again, especially if the ribs are consistently delicious.

I don't understand the bad reviews , I come here almost once every month and the service is great! The food taste good too . The only thing is that it takes awhile for it to come out but otherwise no complaints! There's a reason why there's a tablet on the side so you can pay if you are in a rush !!!

We go a lot.  Love the service it's always very good here.  We are fond of the 2 for $20 dinner and they always get our steak cooked perfect!  We sit in bar area with Marie or Jackie, who are fabulous, and chips n salsa are free.
The burrito is the bomb. The hosted is very nice and we had a great server. Anytime you come here, you are sure to get a good meal. They have plenty of tv's, so you'll be able to watch a lot of games

I ordered a steak medium with shrimp with a side of broccoli and asparagus with tomatoes. Unfortunately, approx 45 min later, when we finally got our food, the asparagus was raw, the steak was overcooked and there were no shrimp. Take 2 - 20 min later - the steak was a hickey puck. About 30 min later a manager came over - still without my food and asked if I would still like my meal. At this point my friends had finished their meals some time ago. I left here hungry and disappointed. This was definitely a horrible experience and I won't be going back.

Went to this Chilis to the guy. Haven't been to Chilis in a long time. The service was great and the food was very tasty. The server was very friendly and efficient. Great job Chilis Meant went to this Chilis today.
One of our family's best spot. We enjoy the atmosphere and the price is right. The waiters are on point and the place is clean.

The service and food at this Chili's location was wonderful and very fast.  We had a party of over 30 people that included both adults and kids.  I love the way the staff pitched in ensure that we were taken care of in a very expeditiously and hospitable manner.  Kudos to Corey and Todd and their awesome manager Jennifer.  Thank you from the West Miramar Cheerleaders and Parents .

Stopped in with my colleague as we were hungry after our client meeting.  We grabbed a seat in the bar area at a high top. We were given some chips & salsa which my colleague was surprised as he is a frequent Chilli's visitor and he never gets chips & salsa. Maybe it happened because I was there...lol. Service was great and I ordered some tilapia special they were having for $10. The tilapia was good and the steamed rice and vegetables were just as good.

Server attended to the kids, food was fast, 2-for-1 small beers lets us share...pretty good for Chili's, since I've had to wait at other locations waaaaay longer...but what puts us up into 4 stars is that my 9 year old son left his wallet 3 DAYS AGO and they still have it, with the cash in it!! They just made a kid's day-he thought for sure it was a goner!

As Expected except for service. I had one of the texmex bowls, it was very good and they were quite generous with the chicken. I sat at the bar and the service was very slow. Only 3 of us at the bar and it took 10 minutes to get a glass of tea. Looked as though bartender was delivering food to tables.

This was not a good day for this Chilis. When we arrived, the hostess asked if we'd like to sit in the bar area because they had free chips and salsa. We asked if we could have a booth and were told to sit wherever we wanted.  Except, there were no clean booths. In fact, the tables were all dirty. So was the floor. After a long wait, a waitress finally came asked if we wanted chips and salsa and took our drink order. After another long wait, chips and salsa along with our drinks arrived.  We had to ask for plates, something I would assume would be a no brainier. Our order was taken and the food came out without incident. Nothing special, but exactly what I would expect from a chain such as this. During our meal, there was an incident at the front door. Two young women were having an argument with an employee about which I have no idea.  One of the women was getting in the employee's face and talking trash. It was quite a scene.  And it was loud. Other employees starting coming out of the kitchen and from other areas of the restaurant to see what was going on. Finally a patron at the bar called the police.  They took some statements and left without any further excitement.  My wife and I waited again for quite some time before the waitress finally came over and asked me if I knew how to work the machine on the table.  This apparently is how you pay now.  I would give this experience 1/2 a star if I could based on the fact that the food was edible. Otherwise, there was nothing else redeeming about our visit.

This place is so inconsistent.  I ordered togo food online, get there early to get it while it's still hot but have to wait 20 minutes only to get ice cold food!  Then the manager says, "tacos get cold quick." What kind of response is that?  I had been waiting for my food it should have been piping hot.  Then the manager didn't even know what the other item I ordered was?  Who's running the show there?  Obviously the manager is incompetent.  This isn't my first time having a problem there and this same manager didn't do anything to fix the problem.  I thought maybe she's having a bad day the first time, but the second time, she shouldn't be a manager.  Bottom line: don't order togo.

I had a $5 coupon for chili's so my wife and I ordered 2 cheese burgers medium rare for pickup. When my wife got there she gave the coupon and the manager Jennifer was rude and told my wife we do not take coupons my wife said why wouldn't you take a chili's coupon. Jennifer the manager said we do not take coupons and walked away. My wife ended up paying for the food. When she got home the food was horrible. The burgers where burnt and dry. Which such a rude manager we decided there would be no point in calling to complain about the burgers. We will not come back to this restaurant.
Bring your winter coat, they keep it at 60¤. No internet, no phone signal. 911 calls only. Today sucked at chilis, never again .

They burned my fajita toppings and served them to me ANYWAY. Smoke was billowing up in a motherfucking cloud from the serving skillet and was filling the seating area. And, she really, truly said, "It smells awful and burnt but it's not! I think we just added too much sauce!" So you're saying your sauce is supposed to smell like burned onions? I'm not sure what you mean. Is that a trademark flavor of Chili's? Burned food? Anyway, the veg was halfway black from the bottom, the meat was overcooked and tasted of burnt veg and she says, "Well, we can replace the vegetables and keep the meat since it's not burned!" Yeah, fuck the customer. Because Chili's can't afford to toss half a chicken breast and 4 shrimp. Anyway, I asked whether the bar had Drambuie. She checks and comes back with, "No, we're out of Jamboree." Bless her heart.

This place is disgusting The food was ice cold the silverware is so dirty how do they expect somebody to eat off there silverware The table was dirty and had sticky stuff all over it The menus was dirty this place even had a awful smell walking in And all of the employees had very dirty work uniforms especially the cook that was in the bathroom

Raw chicken "crispers" and over fried to death onion rings, chicken wings and egg rolls.   The server was very nice and apologetic.   The manager apologized but really didn't care at all. Will never be back.
Service was terrible!!!! We had a reservation for 7:30 we didn't get seated until 8:30!!!! Most unprofessional restaurant I have been to in a long time.

Flew my grandma down to see me about a month ago from Virginia. Got about 4 margaritas and split them...BEST DRINKS IN TOWN!! Sunrise margaritas is to die for. Food wasn't 100% this time but still good!
It's a chilis, decent food good price.  Love the two for one drink specials.   Some of the new menu items were a welcome change from the same old food.

I came here last night with a group of 8 people. I've never been a fan of Chili's, but I thought I might as well give it another shot. I looked through the menu for what felt like an eternity... I kept flipping back and forth trying to find something that sounded remotely appetizing and wasn't deep fried. The person next to me had the exact same problem. She ordered the chicken caesar salad, while I opted for the 8 oz. sirloin and corn on the cob. Everyone else ordered something fried (and fried foods make up 90% of the menu). Once my steak came out, I didn't even have to take a bite to realize it was going to be one very bad meal. The meat looked like a slab of very dry beef jerky, and had the consistency of shoe leather. I managed to cut (no, saw) some of it, but only choked down a few pieces before just giving up on it. I turned to my corn on the cob, and asked for some butter. The waiter brings me a small container of clear-looking liquid that appeared to be vegetable oil. I asked him if he had any non-melted butter, and he said this was all they had. So I poured the "butter" on and ate it, but I'm pretty sure I don't want to know what it actually was. The only thing that made this meal somewhat decent was the company, since we had a good time talking. But it's a bad sign when I leave a restaurant hungry.

This location is absolutely ridiculous. We had to clean our own tables and seat ourselves. Waitress was miserable. Never checked up on us, took forever to bring drinks out and even longer than forever to bring check out. Will never come back to this location. Do not like to under tip because I am in the hospitality business, but did not leave great tip because the service was just horrendous. Hard to understand why since she only had three tables.
Went a few weeks ago and waited forever to get my drink refilled and then forever to get the check. Average food and below average service

Like the previous poster, I'm not particularly pleased with the disproportionate selection of deep fried foods that Chili's offers.  However, I am a huge fan of their 2-for-1's, and after 3 Long Islands, I would probably eat whatever they put in front of me.   As far as appetizers go, their skillet queso is absolutely incredible.  On account of the aforementioned drinks, I'm not exactly sure what I got as a meal, but it was some sort of spicy sandwich that interfered with me drinking more Long Islands because they tasted gross together, but I'm sure it'd be fine on its own.   This Chili's is also great because they will sing really loud and embarrassing if it's somebody's birthday, which indeed it was.  The birthday boy looked absolutely mortified throughout the singing, so I consider it a complete success.  Not a big fan of Chili's in general, but I have no complaints about this location.
Service was okay and food was only mediocre.  I have had much better at chills locations and will not be returning to this location.
Food was great and the servers were friendly with our party of 8. The hostess Jackie was especially wonderful, friendly, bubbly.

I always have a good experience here with food, drinks, and service. I wasn't really a fan of Chili's in general but lately I've been seeing myself come here more often. It's your typical standard Chili's with a large parking lot. This is located in the busy plaza, The Fountains. I love their drink specials, they offer two for one prices on certain drinks (wine, beer, cocktails). I really like their Thursday deal, $5 Presidente margarita. The margarita was so delicious and the drink yields about three glasses (it comes in a shaker). I also really like their chile-lime chicken and rice entree; that is so flavorful with a nice kick to it, it's also on the healthier side. The bar area is usually packed so we always opt for a booth. Our server was always checking up on us and making sure our drinks were filled.  This is definitely my go-to Chili's because it's in a convenient location.

I was extremely short on time and I ran in for a side salad & southwestern egg roll and had an absolutely amazing experience I also had a mai tai cocktail and sat at the bar my food was delivered in about 5-10 minutes flat.

Not a bad place for lunch. The location never gets too crowded. We go here for lunch with my co-workers, so we know the servers and they know us. Be sure to ask for customization, to replace your stale chips, and ask for extra service if you are picky when it comes to service, they will work with you. The manager will gladly come out to address your concerns. I actually like Chilli's menu and choices. It gives you enough options, for any taste. Dont expect above and beyond from anyone at this location, this is perhaps due to their internal culture at the restaurant.

I was a little upset because Chili's recently changed their menu and got rid of my favorite dish...the margarita chicken bowl (I get it without chicken to make it plantbased) but they didn't have it. The waitress though was helpful and suggested the chipotle chicken bowl without the chicken and it was good but was too spicy for my taste (I don't really like spicy). The side salad was very good with the balsamic vinaigrette on top! Suggestion to Chili's: update the allergen menu that's on the kiosk, it's very helpful.
Great customer service each time we dine here! Accomadating and always fresh food. Happy hours are the best!

This is my go-to place for food, drink and fun! I love the staff, the atmosphere and everything about Chili's in Plantation! Always a good time and always affordable. I would recommend this Chili's to anyone!

We came here after my wife's dentist appointment.  We normally go to the the location near our house for drinks and snacks.  They have 2 for 1 all day so it's always happy hours there.  O, since we are already close by, having lunch here seems logical. All the Chilis looks exactly the same, and we found ourselves grabbing two stools at the bar immediately.  First things first, get the 2 for 1 drinks going.  I ordered a draft beer and I noticed that the size of the beer mug they served me is a bit larger than the Chilis near our house.  Or maybe I am imagining things but it sure feels like it.  And my wife ordered her usual Long Island Ice Tea.  She felt it wasted a little bit different than she used to, but said the second drink was a bit strong. For lunch, we ordered a few different appetizer items.  Started off our favorite Southwest Egg Rolls.  The dish came warm and crispy.  We only got Big Mouth Bites instead of three we get at the other place, which seemed odd.  We also got some onion rings and an order of Classic Nachos.   In this visit, All the  food tasted fine.  Our bartender was pretty good and provided excellent service.  The only thing we were not thrill about is their table top tablet.  We paid our bills through it but then we noticed it automatically charged us $1.99 "entertainment" fee.  It took a lot of hassle to get that taken out of our tab.  So be careful and always check your bill, even if it's $1.99.

Casual place. We all know it! Drinks are always 2 for 1 and the food is mediocre. It's just mediocre at best, why?  With a chain as big as they are, why do they have just ok food? It should  be great, they should have a little better caliber chefs.  As i sit here and write this the table next to me is talking about how bland their food is. LOLOL.... I was in a hurry so I didn't sent the food back but it was cold. Isn't there a manager in these chains that just handles making sure ALL the dishes come out perfect? So what if it's a mediocre restaurant chain? That shouldn't matter, should it?  I come here often and something has happened every time and today was enough.  Management, I'm talking to you.........guys make sure the food comes out right....we are the ones that come to places like this. What happens when we stop coming?

Sat at the bar this past weekend and had so much fun. Glenn was the bartender and was totally awesome. He recommended a Presidents Margarita with black cherries. It was to die for. There were lots of customers that seemed to know each other. I was told by one guy he comes here every week and gets something new made by Glen each time. I ate eggrolls and they were pretty good. Glen made  me try the spicy Santa Fe sauce. He called it Santa Clause sauce so that I would remember the name.... hilarious. The manager walked by and was asking people if everything was ok. I thought that was cool. I will definitely come back and sit at the bar.

My girlfriend and I didn't feel like cooking tonight so we decided to stop in at Chili's. Cara was our server and she did a good job. She was attentive and helpful. The food was what you would expect from a Chili's. Most of the appetizers are fried foods however, I did enjoy the Southwestern egg rolls. I had the bacon avocado sandwich and found it to be good. If you've been to a Chili's you're likely familiar with the experience. Only real complaint is that they are utilizing a hand held device at the table for pretty everything your waitress typically does. Not a huge fan of that, but if you're into it then Chili's will suit you.

I was in the mood for soup and salad so my friend and I stopped at Chili's.  It had been a while but the soup and salad did not disappoint.  Tried two of the soups (Chicken Enchilada Soup and Southwest Chicken Soup) and they were equally tasty.  Parker was our server and she was attentive, polite and on the ball.  I will certainly ask for her again the next time I stop in. Did I mention that they offer a Bottomless Soup & Salad for $7.49 at lunch time?  And a Senior discount?  Win - Win
This place  it's one of my favorite , specially because the way Jim treats my family chillis at sawgrass 200 % recommended

Took my son here for his 10th birthday dinner.  Our waitress Maria took our orders without even looking at any of us or smiling.  She put the food on the table and left still without saying anything or making eye contact.   Still not one smile.   It was obvious my sons food had been microwaved to the point that it all stuck together and was hard.  I ordered a buffalo chicken salad and for  some reason it was too salty to eat.  I don't even know how you make a salad salty.  The waitress never came back to check on us.  Finally she saw my full plate at the end of the table and asked if I wanted it to go.  My son was still eating when she started to remove the plates from the table.  The manager came over and was incredibly nice, he removed my salad from the check.

We used to love this place and the one male bartender is still amazing, but we show you a coupon at the beginning of the meal that won't open at the end and you don't honor it anyway, the manager has to get most of our beverages and it takes 25 minutes to check out... so disappointed.

We both ordered ribs with french fries and a side salad. The french fries never saw the deep fryer they were brought in and put in an oven I like a little bit a grease on my french fries they had no taste. The side salads were order with blue cheese and they never saw the blue cheese it was more like buttermilk dressing. The service was good the ribs were good disappointed in the salads and fries.

Arrived at Chili's for st patty day fun ordered appetizers and ice tea's. .even explained easy on the coke and sour..well we ended up with lemonade..we asked the waitress to return them for just a glass of wine and a cosmo..All of a sudden an elderly scraggly haired woman appeared ..slapped her palms against the table and said I will not make you any mixed drinks you can have beer or wine or straight shots..we asked her are you serious..and your tone is as inappropriate as your manners.. Can we see a manager?..she said she was the manager..Woe... We informed her she was out of order and out of control.. this is 2016 and we still have to deal with this. .We didn't accept it and instead of lowering ourselves to her level we informed her we would be taking our business elsewhere. .We proceeded to Duffy's the better choice..The service and professionalism ranked #1..Happy St Patty Day to the employees and staff at Duffy's Plantation...A BIG FAT GOOSE EGG FOR CHILI'S PLANTATION..000000..

Chili's has really worked hard to upgrade its menu via customer feedback. Looks like it has worked! The place was packed when we came in on a fun weekend day! Everyone, [customers] had their favorite team shirt on, and all the while trying to yell louder than the next person! Lol!! This was electric energy! We found a place to sit and commence our fun too. It is 2 for 1 Happy Hour all the time we are told and they have Kiosks on the tables like many other restaurants.  If you sit in the bar chips & salsa are Always Free if you just ask! We actually abstained! I know right!! Appetizers are 1/2 price. We wanted to try their enchiladas. No judging please! This is S FL and pretty much Mexican food is non- existence, so why Not! Well let me tell you we pleasantly Surprised! Bottomless Enchiladas choices to begin are chicken with cream sauce or green chile verde. Ground beef w a red sauce. We both chose chicken and cream sauce and the verde! White meat chicken breast seasoned deliciously rolled in corn tortillas with cheese and covered in the sauces with cilantro rice and choice of beans. Bean choices; pinto or black. We both got black and these were fantastic! Tender, seasoned and made with tlc! The rice was fluffy with the delicious cilantro all stirred through. They hit the mark with this for sure! Wowzers! I remembered I had a glass of wine lol, n sipped it. Sam Adams Lager for my love. Aahh! Chili's congrats on the new items on the menu!  Our server Ashley was attentive and checked back at just the right times with a smile. The employee atmosphere was warm and cheerful. I certainly felt they enjoyed being there and wanted all the customers smiling. Chili's Keep the prices reasonable and the great choices on tap and happy hour! Oh! Great Servers like Ashley IS a Must. Thank You!!   5 stars Chili's home Run!!

Worst place to eat! The service was awful. They did not brought straws and silverware! They were expecting us to eat with our hands. I asked for a side of French fries and the arrived when I was done eating! Never coming back

I was looking for a good place that serves happy hour and boy did I find it. From the phenomenal service to the amazing drinks. J.T. Is by far the best bartender I've ever had serve me. He managed to have a great conversation all while mixing drinks (which were mixed to perfection!). I really enjoyed myself.

My favorite go-to lunch spot. First things first. The hostess. I've never met someone who truly seems like they love their job the way she does. And if she doesn't then this woman needs an Emmy. Every time I go there I'm greeted by this woman who treats her customers like they are family. It's amazing. You know, another thing I love? BOGO drinks. The adult kind. Any place that gives me a margarita for free after I order one AND it tastes great. Major points in my book. The service is always good; having polite and attentive waitstaff. I never find myself having an issue with anything. The food arrives quickly and always how I wanted it to be. The food itself is standard Chili's grub. If that's what you want, then you'll be pleased. The endless chips and salsa are my favorite as is the guacamole burger. Oh yeah, and the quesadilla salad, that's if you need a few items to help make your selection easier.
